generif.text: Based on homology, two new isoforms for ACSL1 were predicted and characterized, one represented a switch of the Phe- to the Tyr-Gate domain motif, the other resulted from the exclusion of both.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Data show that ACSL1 rs9997745 polymorphism influences metabolic syndrome risk, most likely via disturbances in fatty acid metabolism, which was modulated by dietary fat consumption, particularly PUFA intake, suggesting novel gene-nutrient interactions.
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Findings suggest that the ACSL1 gene polymorphism rs6552828 is not associated with elite endurance athletic status in Caucasians, yet a marginal association seems to exist for the Chinese (Han) male population.

INSR rs1366600, ACSL1 rs2292899 and FABP2 rs11724758 could influence the susceptibility to type 2 diabetes in Chinese Han population, most likely through their effects on the specific miRNA-binding sites.
long-chain acyl-CoA synthetase 1 has a role in eicosapentaenoic acid suppression of palmitate-induced cytokine production
Data indicate that expression of miR-205 is negatively related to that of ACSL1 in clinical hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) tissues.

the cell surface protein CD36/FAT directly facilitates fatty acid transport across the plasma membrane, whereas the intracellular acyl-CoA synthetases FATP4 and ACSL1 enhance fatty acid uptake indirectly by metabolic trapping
ACSL1 is a programmable mediator of insulin sensitivity and cellular lipid content.
evidence in humans of ACSL1 SNPs associated with fasting glucose, diabetes, and subclinical atherosclerosis
SRE motif in ACSL1 is essential for SREBP2-mediated activation of C-ACSL1 gene transcription.

Study identified a genetic variant in the 3'-UTR region of ACSL1 gene (rs8086) that may play a significant role in predicting outcomes of stage II/III patients with colon cancer, so that patients with T/T genotype had a significantly higher risk of tumor recurrence than those carrying at least one C allele.

The mRNA levels of ACSL1 were positively associated with those of HBXIP in clinical breast cancer tissues. Thus, we conclude that the oncoprotein HBXIP is able to up-regulate ACSL1 through activating the transcriptional factor Sp1 in breast cancer.
These results suggest that ACSL1, ACSL4 and ACSL5 expression is regulated by ER signaling pathways and ACSL5 is a potential novel biomarker for predicting prognosis of breast cancer patients.
Both ACSL1 rs9997745 and PPARGC1A rs8192678 are associated with pre-diabetes mellitus in Mexican-Mestizos, and obesity/BMI significantly modified their association.

Inhibition of ACSL1 activity in the cells with triacsin C significantly suppressed the expression of these inflammatory markers and TNF-alpha-induced inflammatory markers expression in monocytic cells requires ACSL1.
ACSL1 expression was remarkably reduced in clear cell renal cell carcinoma cells.

Expression of ACSL1 and Nrf2 were down-regulated in obesity-related nephropathy (ORN) patients, ob/ob mice and palmitic acid-treated HK-2 cells. Nrf2 downregulation increases reactive oxygen species production and oxidative stress. Increased oxidative stress will suppress the expression of ACSL1 ultimately leading to renal lipid deposition in renal tubulars and accelerating the development of ORN.
ACSL1 Regulates TNFalpha-Induced GM-CSF Production by Breast Cancer MDA-MB-231 Cells.
We conclude that acs-13 mutations in C. elegans and ACSL1 knockdown in human cells prevent lipotoxicity by promoting increased levels of polyunsaturated fatty acid-containing phospholipids
ACSL1 affects Triglyceride Levels through the PPARgamma Pathway.
Metabolic reprogramming of ovarian cancer involves ACSL1-mediated metastasis stimulation through upregulated protein myristoylation.
Long-chain fatty acyl-CoA synthetase 1 promotes prostate cancer progression by elevation of lipogenesis and fatty acid beta-oxidation.
Ferroptotic cell death triggered by conjugated linolenic acids is mediated by ACSL1.
Circular RNA circACSL1 aggravated myocardial inflammation and myocardial injury by sponging miR-8055 and regulating MAPK14 expression.
Common genetic basis of ALS patients and soccer players may contribute to disease risk.
FATP2 regulates non-small cell lung cancer by mediating lipid metabolism through ACSL1.

Identification of toll-like receptor 5 and acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 1 as hub genes are correlated with the severe forms of COVID-19 by Weighted gene co-expression network analysis.
Fatty acids and inflammatory stimuli induce expression of long-chain acyl-CoA synthetase 1 to promote lipid remodeling in diabetic kidney disease.
RBM45 reprograms lipid metabolism promoting hepatocellular carcinoma via Rictor and ACSL1/ACSL4.
ACSL1: A preliminary study that provides a new target for the treatment of renal fibrosis could bring new insights in diabetic kidney disease.
ACSL1-Mediated Fatty Acid beta-Oxidation Enhances Metastasis and Proliferation in Endometrial Cancer.

wikipathways.name: Cholesterol metabolism (includes both Bloch and Kandutsch-Russell pathways)

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is an isozyme of the long-chain fatty-acid-coenzyme A ligase family. Although differing in substrate specificity, subcellular localization, and tissue distribution, all isozymes of this family convert free long-chain fatty acids into fatty acyl-CoA esters, and thereby play a key role in lipid biosynthesis and fatty acid degradation. Several transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2013].
